abstract: The decision by the government opens the door for Wal-Mart, Tesco, Ikea and other firms to establish a presence in one of the world’s biggest markets.
snippet: The decision by the government opens the door for Wal-Mart, Tesco, Ikea and other firms to establish a presence in one of the world’s biggest markets.
lead_paragraph: MUMBAI — The Indian government decided on Thursday to allow foreign retailers like Wal-Mart and Tesco to open stores in the country, the first time that policy makers have moved to open India’s vast and fast-growing retail market to outsiders.

headline.main: India to Ease Retail Rules for Foreign Companies
headline.print_headline: India to Ease Retail Rules For Foreign Companies
